version_description:
Since I first wrote Pedometer++ it has been one of my six year old son's favorite apps. He loves checking to see if I have hit my daily step goal and then watching the green confetti that rains down. After much consideration, he has decided that if you double your goal the confetti should be blue. So now it is. :)

Also, I have added the ability to disable automatic distance estimation. If you prefer to use a fixed stride length you can now do so. Enjoy!

As always if you have a minute to write a review for the app I'd really appreciate it. They really do help other people find and get the app. Thank you.

—Dave

Thanks for all the kind words around the launch of 2.3, I'm so glad to hear how warmly it was received. This update includes a few little fixes for issues that slipped through my testing:
- The Great Confetti Shortage of 2015 has been resolved. There was a bug that could have prevented confetti from falling when you hit your goal under certain circumstances. The bug has been fixed and the amount of confetti going forward has been increased by 5% to compensate for lost delight.
- Plus, lots of little stability improvements and fixes.
Thanks for all your continued support of Pedometer++. If you have a minute to leave a review in the App Store I'd really appreciate it. They really help in getting the app in front of more and more people. Thanks!

—Dave

This update is all about cleaning out all the little nagging bugs that I have found over the last few months. Nothing too major but overall you should find the app much more responsive and reliable. The fixes included:

- Speed of refreshing your step counts (with new activity indicator)
- Fix issues with Apple Watch complications not showing icons correctly
- Fix issues where the step badge wouldn't update correctly.

Thank you for your continued support of Pedometer++, you rock.

A few little goodies in this update.
- Better complications for the Apple Watch (especially the Modular watch face)
- Avoid a situation where the confetti wouldn't be shown after reaching your goal
- Minor fixes and improvements

If you have a minute to leave a review for Pedometer++ in the App Store I'd really appreciate it. It really helps.

Thanks,
Dave

This update brings support for iOS 10 and watch OS 3, plus a handful of other minor improvements
- Added support for the new wheelchair mode on the Apple Watch. Will switch from steps to pushes as the goal metric.
- Improved the operation of the Apple Watch walking workout
- Improved the complication refresh interval and accuracy on Apple Watch
- Added the ability to share your step count and goal progress in iMessage

Thank you for all the great feedback about our iOS 10 and watchOS 3 updates. This is a bug fix update that clears up a few little bugs that slipped through including:
- Fixes to Portuguese and German Localizations
- Fix resizing bug in iMessage app
- Substantial improvements to the stability of the Apple Watch walking mode.

Keep the feedback coming it really helps me improve the app. If you have a minute to leave a review in the App Store for Pedometer++ I'd really appreciate it. Thanks!

To start the year off right this update introduces Goal Streak Tracking to help keep you motivated to hit your goal each day. How long of a streak of days can you get?

This includes a mechanism for allowing you to have a single rest day each week where you won't break your streak just for resting up. You can turn this off in settings if you want every day to count towards your streak.

Additionally, I also fixed a bunch of bugs with accessibility and the Apple Watch complication display.

Happy New Year!

Whoops, a few little bugs slipped through in the last update (which added Goal Streak Tracking).
- Fix a bug where scrolling the view to the left would keep bouncing back.
- Fix a bug where settings were hard to change on smaller iPhones
- Fix a bug where the weekly summaries would change while you scrolled.

Thanks for all the feedback in helping me track these down.

This update is geared around trying to tidy up a lot of loose ends and fixing lingering bugs. It includes:
- Fix a bug that caused old data to change (note: you may see a one time adjustment the first time you run the new update)
- Fix a bug that prevented the graph from re-centering onto the current week
- Update the icon to be a cleaner and clearer
- Add a warning when switching to Wheelchair Mode but your Apple Watch isn't in wheelchair mode
- Add the ability (in the Settings area) to switch the app's icon to one more appropriate for Wheelchair Mode when active.

If you see anything else please let me know, I'm working on a pretty big update next and want everything to be nice and stable before that rolls out.

—Dave

This update unfortunately needed to remove the step-count icon badge feature. As an alternative I recommend adding Pedometer++ to your today widget list (swipe left-most on your home screen), or hard press on its icon on an iPhone 6s or 7 to see your current step counts.

This update also includes a fix for an issue with resetting the alternative wheelchair icon, a Russian localization correction, and better display of missing days in the app.

Thank you for your understanding.

I'm delighted to announce version 3.0 of Pedometer++. I've been working on Pedometer++ for the last four years I've worked to constantly improve and enhance the app, to make it more and more motivating, and to keep it up to date with the latest capabilities of our devices. This update brings with it two major features and a truckload of little improvements and tweaks.
- ACHIEVEMENTS! You now earn badges for the steps you take and the floors you climb. These are available via the top right button from the main screen. My hope is that these will provide you with another source of encouragement and motivation to stay active.
- Enhanced widget. The widget you can access from the lock or home screen now includes a detailed graph of your current day's activity to show you your progress more clearly.

Additionally, I've done lots of work behind the scenes fixing little bugs or smoothing over past issues. I hope you enjoy this update.

—Dave

[In v3.0.1, I fix a layout bug for smaller devices, a Portuguese translation, address an issue with wheelchair mode badges, the streak date being incorrect and a VoiceOver problem.]

This update is all about taking advantage of the new abilities recently added to iOS and watchOS. These include:
- The ability to sync and measure floors using a Series 3 Apple Watch (ensure that "Merge Apple Watch Data" is turned on)
- Support for the new iPhone screen layouts
- Re-add the summary steps/distance display to the bottom of the Settings area by popular demand

- Plus, lots of little bug fixes and tweaks:
-- Localization fixes for German, Russian and Spanish
-- Resolve a situation where the app could get stuck in Wheelchair Mode accidentally

Thanks for your continued support for Pedometer++. If you come across anything on a new device or OS that I've missed please let me know so that I can get is fixed ASAP. Thank you!

—Dave

This update includes:
- Distance based badges! Earn badges based on how far you've walked with Pedometer++
- Added a badge for 15 Million steps. Much to my surprise many of you have already reached your 10 Million step badge, so I wanted to add something else for you to walk towards.
- Fixed perfect month badge calculations

This update includes:
- The ability to start either an outdoor or indoor (treadmill) walk in the Apple Watch app
- A fix for a rare bug that resulted in missing day counts
- A lot of clean up and minor fixes to issues introduced by the last update.

Just a few fixes in this one.
› Fix an issue that could case the app to freeze on launch when it hadn't been opened in a while.
› Faster loading of Apple Watch step data

Speeeeed! This update is all about making scrolling faster, especially when you have lots of history with Pedometer++ (thank you for sticking with it!). You should see greatly increased performance when moving around within the app.

(Also fixed an issue where Apple Watch steps would get start syncing correctly after you do a backup/restore)

This update includes a few features that I've been hoping to add to Pedometer++ for a while but never quite got around to it.
- You can now transfer your step history to another iPhone. Simply email the export file (Export.steps) to the new iPhone and then open it. Your steps will be merged into the new iPhone's database. The merge process will keep any steps you have taken on your new phone.
- You can now tap the workout screen in the Apple Watch app to toggle between seeing your total daily steps or only the steps you've taken in the current workout/walk.

Also fixed:
- Occasional streak marker alignment bug
- An issue with the rest day switch in settings.

I'm very excited to announce this update. It is primarily focused on dramatic improvements to Pedometer++’s Apple Watch app. The old Apple Watch app served its purpose but lacked flexibility and capability. Now I can take advantage of the significant improvements found in modern Apple Watches to dramatically improve what's possible. The new Apple Watch app:
- Provides a beautiful, customizable workout metric display
- Includes a colorful, glanceable heart rate history graph
- Adopts robust support for the new Hiking mode including a real-time elevation profile
- Lets you record a GPS track of your workout and even display it on a map right from your wrist
- Incorporates media controls right in the app so you can control your music or podcast without leaving the app
- Adopts all the new complication types
- Let’s you completely customize your workout display to tailor the metrics shown to your needs.

Additionally, this update adds support for additional screen sizes.

I hope you enjoy this update as much as I have enjoyed making and testing it out.

—Dave

To kick off 2019 with some added motivation, I'm introducing new Monthly Challenge badges. Each month I'm going to add a unique badge you can earn based on your activity. The first badge of 2019 has the objective of reaching your daily step goal 19 times in January. I hope these additional challenges will help you to find that little bit of extra motivation to get up and moving.

Happy New Year!

—Dave

Little update improving the badge system:

Thanks for all the great feedback about the monthly challenges, I'm so glad to hear they are a fun new motivator. I can't wait to show you all the cool updates that are coming soon!

This update includes the April Monthly Challenge.  In January the goal as 19 days of meeting your goal, for April I wanted to push that a little bit further.  The goal for April is to reach your goal 21 days.  Best of luck and get walking!
This update includes the May challenge badge.  This is the last of these small updates before a big update I have planned for mid-May.  I can't wait to show it to you.

Introducing Pedometer++ version 4.0! This update is all about letting you personalize Pedometer++ to your tastes.
• Support for Fixed Timezones. You can set the app to your home timezone and it will always display your step counts in that location. So when you travel your streaks and achievements don't get mixed up.
• I've added a few new color themes for the app:
• A Dark Mode for situations where you'd prefer a less bright display
• A new color palette option that is designed with colorblind users in mind. My typical red-orange-green theming is less than ideal for users with color differentiation limitations so I worked with some accessibility experts to come up with a theme that should provide more contrast for all users.
• You can now set alternative icons for the app, to make it fit in with your home screen aesthetic.
• I re-worked how your daily step goal is changed within the app. Previously your goal would apply to your entire history and changing it would update it for every day in the app. This made it really awkward to increase your goal over time, as you'd loose your old achievements and streaks. Now changing your goal doesn't affect your past data, only the current day and moving forward. So starting at a lower goal and then slowly increasing over time works much better.
• The monthly challenges are now pre-loaded into the app so they'll appear on the first day of each month, without needing an app update.
• I also refreshed the design of the Apple Watch app making it fit in better with the overall system apps.

I hope this update makes Pedometer++ feel even more personal to you and in turn gives you that little extra boost to get out there walking.

—Dave
